perturbation.original_text: In providing Merchant Processing Services, NPC agrees to comply with: (i) all Visa and MasterCard Bylaws, Manuals, Operating Regulations and other written materials as they may from time to time be amended which bind or apply to NCB as a member of Visa and MasterCard with respect to Merchant Processing Services or to NPC as a third party processor with respect to Merchant Processing Services ("Rules"), (ii) all agreements between Merchants and NCB with respect to Merchant Processing Services, and (iii) all applicable laws and regulations, whether state or federal.
perturbation.changed_text: In providing Merchant Processing Services, NPC agrees to comply with: (i) all Visa and MasterCard Bylaws, Manuals, Operating Regulations and other written materials as they may from time to time be amended which bind or apply to NCB as a member of Visa and MasterCard with respect to Merchant Processing Services or to NPC as a third party processor with respect to Merchant Processing Services ("Rules"), (ii) all agreements between Merchants and NCB with respect to Merchant Processing Services.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause obligating NPC to comply with 'all applicable laws and regulations, whether state or federal' in providing merchant processing services, the contract creates a loophole where NPC might not adhere to consumer protection laws related to fair lending, data security, or other relevant statutes. This exposes consumers to potential harm and violates laws designed to protect them in financial transactions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various state and federal consumer protection laws (e.g., Truth in Lending Act, Fair Credit Reporting Act, state data security laws)

perturbation.original_text: NPC agrees to comply with all laws and regulations relating to confidentiality of customer lists and other information which are applicable to NCB and its agents or to NPC. NCB agrees to comply with all contractual obligations of NPC actually known to NCB and all laws and regulations applicable to NCB or NPC relating to confidentiality of customer lists and other information.
perturbation.changed_text: NCB agrees to comply with all contractual obligations of NPC actually known to NCB and all laws and regulations applicable to NCB or NPC relating to confidentiality of customer lists and other information.
perturbation.explanation: Removing NPC's explicit agreement to comply with confidentiality laws and regulations weakens data protection for consumers. Many states have stringent laws regarding the handling of personal financial data. Omitting NPC's compliance clause creates a risk that NPC might not fully adhere to those regulations, potentially leading to data breaches and violations of consumer privacy rights. By deleting the clause, the contract introduces a legal risk relating to consumer data protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State data breach notification laws, Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLBA), California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)

perturbation.original_text: NPC shall admit properly identified and authorized NCB employees and agents onto its premises for purposes of monitoring NPC's compliance with this Agreement. It is understood that such monitoring will occur during normal business hours, will be preceded by reasonable notification to NPC, and must not interfere with NPC's normal operations.
perturbation.changed_text: NPC shall admit properly identified and authorized NCB employees and agents onto its premises for purposes of monitoring NPC's compliance with this Agreement. It is understood that such monitoring must not interfere with NPC's normal operations.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'will occur during normal business hours, will be preceded by reasonable notification to NPC,' the amended text allows NCB to monitor at any time, without notice, potentially disrupting NPC operations. The removal of this clause could lead to non-compliance with labor laws or privacy regulations, creating a **legal contradiction**.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Employment laws and privacy regulations regarding workplace monitoring.
